description.english: Kill any ungulate
Reach 50% affinity with trial mate
Take over a hex owned by another wolf pack.
Bring a fawn or calf carcass home to your pups.
Defend your den from predators.
Hunger takes a pup.
Lose a pup to a predator.
Pup recovers from illness.
Lose a pup to illness.
Pup wanders off....and never comes back
Recover a wandering pup.
Take all your pups into the water for a family swim.
Raise your pups through the Young Hunters quest on Easy with at least two pups.
Raise your pups  through the Young Hunters quest on Challenging with at least two pups.
Raise your pups through the Young Hunters quest  on Accurate or Unforgiving with at least two pups.
Take over a carcass from a competitor.
Find and kill a beaver.
Find a fish dropped by an eagle.
Get rejected by a potential mate.
Reject an interested mate.
Find a new mate after losing your first one.
Get a four star (diversity) mate.
Get a one star (diversity) mate.
Claim 20 hexes in your territory.
Travel two kilometers or more to a rendezvous site.
Your mate dies defending the pups.

displayName.english: Biting Off More Than You Can Chew

description.english: Claim 30 hexes in your territory,
Discover 10 dens before choosing one.

displayName.english: Look What the Wolf Dragged In

description.english: Bring a human object back to your pups.

displayName.english: I'm Juggling As Fast As I Can

description.english: Finish the Growing Pups quest as a single parent (solo from start of Journey to Rendezvous Site  quest)
Raise your pups to the end of Young Hunters as a male Ironwolf.
Raise your pups to the end of Young Hunters as a female Ironwolf

displayName.english: Home Is Where the Heart Is

description.english: Choose the same den that you were born in.
Playing as one of your pups, raise your own pups through the Young Hunters quest.
Reach the advanced age of eight.
As a grown runt, raise your own pups to the end of Young Hunters.
Reach age eight as an Ironwolf.
Choose a peaceful death after reaching age eight.
Postpone aging your wolf four times in a row.
Choose every age perk over the course of your life.
Reach age eight with the same mate since age two.
Outlive your mate after you both reach age eight.
Collect all eight objects in the Amethyst map
Collect all eight objects in Slough Creek map
Visit six landmarks on the Amethyst Map
Visit six landmarks on the Slough Creek Map
Something's wrong with this moose...
Multiplayer: Claim and hold 15 or more hexes on Amethyst for four game days.
Multiplayer: Claim and hold 20 territory hexes for six game days.
Multiplayer: Defeat a group of six or more stranger wolves attacking your den without losing any pups.
Multiplayer: Stay the favorite adult of a pup through the summer, until the end of Growing Pups.
Multiplayer: Win over a pup that had another player as their favorite.
Multiplayer: Raise your pups to completion of Young Hunters,  on Challenging with at least three pups alive at the end.
Multiplayer: Raise your pups to completion of Young Hunters,  on Accurate  or Unforgiving, with at least three pups alive at the end.
Multiplayer: Find and bring eight unique collectible objects to the home site (all must be at home at the same time).
Multiplayer: Bring every kind of small carcass to the home site. (Elk calf, moose calf, mule deer fawn, hare, pronghorn, and beaver must all be at home site at the same time.)
Multiplayer: Four or more player-wolves kill a bull elk together, without dying along the way.
Multiplayer: Four or more player-wolves kill a healthy bull bison together, without dying along the way.
Multiplayer: Playing on the No Vacancy territory configuration, raise your pups to completion of Young Hunters, with at least three pups alive at the end (on any difficulty but Easy).
Multiplayer: On Normal Time mode, raise your pups to completion of Young Hunters, with at least three pups alive at the end (on any difficulty but Easy).
Visit eight natural landmarks in Lost River (DLC)
Visit eight human landmarks in Lost River (DLC)
Collect all ten objects on the Lost River (DLC) map
Sleep in a dog house.
Sleep in three human beds.
Enjoy the view from the porch on the glass house.
Boil to death in a hot spring.
Visit all the dams, human and beaver.
Kill a domestic calf at the ranch (and escape with your life).
Lost your life at the cattle ranch.
Free yourself from the rancher's trap
Bring a trial mate to the Lost Cup Coffee Shop
Have a litter of seven pups at the Carnival den.
Have a litter of two pups of one sex and three of another, at the ghost town den.
Have a litter of pups underneath the abandoned truck.
Bring your pups to Carmella's Pizzeria.
Take your pups swimming in a backyard pool.
Move to a rendezvous site more than 5 kilometers away.
Loaf for five days at the rendezvous site at the Lost River cemetery.
Bring your pups to the hunting lodge.
Visit Floppy in every season.
Brave the darkness and find the deepest point in Lost Luck silver mine.
Collect six skulls.
Collect eight antlers.
Find the lost dog Carmella.
Find a wolf skull (and contemplate your mortality).
Bring every kind of animal skull to the home site. (Elk, moose, bison, mule deer, cougar, grizzly bear, and wolf skulls must all be at home site at the same time.)
Find a cattle skull.
Collect all eight objects on the map.
Visit six locations on and around Hellroaring Mountain.
Mark the summit cairn on Hellroaring Mountain with your mate.
Starting at the confluence with Hellroaring Creek, swim down the Yellowstone below the cliffs with your mate.
Get shot by a hunter outside the park boundary-- and escape to tell the tale.
Win a carcass fight with a wolverine.
Kill the leucistic elk in Snowberry herd (only on the map in fall season, in the northern area). (Hellroaring DLC)
Find the electronic predator/prey caller outside the park, during the fall hunting season.
Have a litter with three male and three female pups at the Balanced Rock den.
Move from a rendezvous site on one side of the Yellowstone River to another on the other side.
During your journey to a rendezvous site, take your pups over the Stock Bridge across Hellroaring Creek.
Take a cool swim with your pups in the pool below Cottonwood Falls.
Bring pups to the Enchanted Forest and sleep to enjoy a special dream.
Spend five days at rendezvous site at the hunter's lean-to.
During hunting season (fall, in the daytime), go to the hunting camp with your mate and howl, then run back into the park without getting shot at all.
Fight off a rival pack's invasion of one of your hexes.
Maintain a territory of at least 15 hexes during the Young Hunters quest.
Help three Young Hunter pups to achieve maximum XP before they grow to 70 pounds.
Raise a pup who disperses before turning two.
A pup returns to your pack after dispersing.
Raise a litter of pups as a single parent from Growing Pups until they are 15 months and old enough to disperse.
Raise pups who become pack leaders in every rival pack on one map.
Become the leader of a rival pack.
Lead a pack with pups born in five consecutive years.
A pup who has stayed with your pack until age five finally disperses.
Spend a year as a lone wolf (in Survive Alone quest).
One of your pups becomes leader of an established rival pack.
Have four mates by the time you reach the age of seven.
Playing as one of your dispersed pups, become the dominant pack on the map (i.e., it has the largest territory on the map).
Lose your mate or adult packmate to an attack by a rival pack led by one of your pups.
After your wolf dies as an elder wolf, play as one of your offspring and keep the pack going until you are an elder wolf.
Playing as a newly-dispersed wolf, successfully court a wolf who is a member of a rival pack.
Playing as a dispersed wolf, before taking a mate, find one of your dispersed siblings on the map.
Win a fight against a pack led by one of your wolf's siblings.
Encounter a pup who suffered an Unknown Fate years ago. (Biological offspring only.)
Always stay at the homesite to watch the pups when packmates go on an excursion, through one season. (Raise Pups through Growing Pups)  (Multiplayer Saga Year or Full Saga))
Kill an ungulate carcass beyond nametag distance from the homesite and bring the carcass back to a player who stayed home.  (Multiplayer Saga Year or Full Saga))
During Young Hunters, bring your entire pack to every rival pack's territory -- and howling and marking together, steal a hex in each territory.  (Multiplayer Saga Year or Full Saga))
Get three Young Hunters pups to max XP before any of them reach 70 pounds.  (Multiplayer Saga Year or Full Saga))
Spend one year (from Raise Pups through completion of Young Hunters) where no players kill any rival wolves. (Multiplayer Saga Year or Full Saga))
Spend 24 consecutive game-hours out hunting with your partner only (staying within nametag distance of each other), no NPC packmates.(Multiplayer 2-Player Full Saga)
Spend 24 consecutive game-hours away from your homesite, hunting alone (beyond nametag distance), with neither your partner nor any NPC packmates. (2-Player Full Saga)
Go through an entire game year (from Raise Pups through completion of Young Hunters) with neither player dying.  (Multiplayer 2-Player Full Saga)
Complete the entire Saga, from age two until both player-wolves are Elder Wolves. (Multiplayer 2-Player Full Saga)
Find the collectable object near a familiar, classic rendezvous site in Slough Creek.
